title: Tangled - Closing Credits Font
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300im_/http:/typophile.com/files/shot002_4336.jpg)

Hi,

Can anyone identify the font used in the end credits of Disney's Tangled?

Thanks
author: mattbury

comments.content:
Not certain these bouncy and tipsy letters are a font. If so I hope someone spots it for you.  
Here are some fonts I like in this style.  
Three from Filmotype: Orlando [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/orlando/Filmotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/orlando/Filmotype "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/orlando/Filmotype") Parade [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/parade/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/parade/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/parade/") and Panama [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/panama/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/panama/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/panama/")  
Brian Bonislawsky's Mother Hen [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/astigmatic/mother-hen-aoe/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/astigmatic/mother-hen-aoe/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/astigmatic/mother-hen-aoe/")  
Andrew Lines' Jester [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/drewfonts/jester/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/drewfonts/jester/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/drewfonts/jester/")  
Bob Alonso's Yakety Yak [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/yakety-yak/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/yakety-yak/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/yakety-yak/")  
Alex Kaczun's Beatnik Barbie [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/beatnik-barbie/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/beatnik-barbie/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/beatnik-barbie/") and Hippyfreak [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/hippyfreak/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/hippyfreak/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/hippyfreak/")  
Jeremy Dooley's Kidela [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/kidela/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/kidela/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/kidela/")  
Tart Workshop's Sugarplum Sweet [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tart-workshop/sugarplum/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tart-workshop/sugarplum/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tart-workshop/sugarplum/")  
Don
After careful close up looking (both o's are different etc) I think this is caligraphy and not a font, i.e. hand done.

This was a pretty small sample so I looked for more lettering from the end credits. Here is a collage of some of what I found.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824183300im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TangledEndCreditsCollage_3463.jpg)
  
Lots of variation in repeating letters. Even a font with many alternates would not do this. In my opinion this is definitely hand lettering. My recommendations for substitute fonts still seem appropriate.  
Don

These suggestions are great Don, many thanks for taking the time to reply to my post in such a thorough way. You the man!

Matt
